results.definition: out of the way (especially away from one's thoughts)
from a particular thing or place or position (`forth' is obsolete)
examples: wanted to get away from there
sent the children away to boarding school
the teacher waved the children away from the dead animal

results.definition: in reserve; not for immediate use
examples: has a nest egg tucked away for a rainy day

results.definition: (of a baseball pitch) on the far side of home plate from the batter
at a distance in space or time
examples: the boat was 5 miles off (or away)
the party is still 2 weeks off (or away)
you must not allow a stranger into the house when your mother is away
